text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that satire uses the original work as a vehicle to comment on a different issue. The candidate answer discusses the third shirt, which is a 'warped version of the character that mocked one of the famous jokes in the show' (parody/satire). In the US analysis, the candidate explicitly states regarding parody: 'A parody that comments on or criticizes the original work is more likely to be transformative' and 'The court would ask whether the new use has a substantially different purpose from the original, or whether it merely serves as a substitute in the same market (merchandise).' This directly addresses the concept that satire/parody uses the original work as a vehicle for commentary on something else (either the original work itself or a different issue).", "criterion_id": "a9c831d9-dab7-42a9-b899-db182e763205"}
